TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant sustained injuries in a car accident caused by an employee of a certain company . The applicant sued the company in ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) . In DATE the court granted the applicant a DATE allowance compensating him for loss of his ability to work ( renta uzupełniająca ) .
On DATE the applicant filed an action with ORG . He asked the court to increase his allowance but he did not specify the value of the claim .
On DATE the court ordered the applicant to specify , within DATE , the value of the claim . The applicant submitted the required information on DATE .
The first hearing was held on DATE but the applicant failed to appear .
On DATE the court held a hearing and again ordered the applicant to specify the value of his claim .
On DATE the case was transferred to ORG ( Sąd Wojewódzki ) , since , given the value of the claim , ORG was no longer competent to deal with the subject matter .
Subsequently , the applicant withdrew the power of attorney granted to his lawyer and FAC ( Okręgowa PERSON ) appointed another counsel for him .
DATE and DATE ORG held CARDINAL hearings .
On DATE the ORG gave judgment and granted the applicant ’s claim .
On DATE the applicant challenged the impartiality of all the judges sitting in ORG . He also asked for his officially appointed lawyer to be replaced .
On DATE the applicant made a second challenge to the impartiality of the judges .
On DATE , upon the applicant ’s appeal , ORG ( Sąd Apelacyjny ) quashed the first - instance judgment and remitted the case .
On DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE and DATE ORG held hearings .
Meanwhile , the applicant made CARDINAL more challenges to the impartiality of ORG and asked that the judges be disqualified from dealing with his case .
On DATE the applicant modified his claim .
On DATE the ORG delivered judgment . On DATE , ruling on the applicant ’s appeal , ORG upheld the first - instance judgment .

On DATE the applicant lodged a cassation appeal . On DATE ORG transferred the case to ORG . On DATE a single judge sitting in camera as ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal as being manifestly ill - founded .

A cassation appeal was introduced to LAW in DATE . Under the provisions applicable until DATE , a party to civil proceedings could lodge a cassation appeal with ORG against a final judicial decision of a second - instance court . Such an appeal had to be examined at a public hearing . This had created inevitable organisational problems , as the judges of ORG were overburdened by the number of cassation appeals which they had to deal with .

On DATE the Code of Civil Procedure was amended . The amendment provides for a preliminary examination of cassation appeals . A single judge sitting in camera as ORG may refuse to entertain a cassation appeal if that appeal is manifestly ill - founded . Where a cassation appeal has been admitted , it is further examined by a panel of CARDINAL judges at a public hearing . However , the relevant transitional rules did not explain clearly whether the new procedure should also apply to cassation appeals lodged before DATE . On DATE ORG adopted a resolution ( no . III CZP CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) and answered this question in affirmative . The court stressed , inter alia , that the amendments to LAW made it possible to deal with enormous backlog of trivial or manifestly ill - founded cassation appeals .

Under Section CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure , a court which has given the contested decision is competent to decide whether all formal requirements for a cassation appeal have been complied with . If an appeal has complied with the formal requirements , the case shall be transferred to ORG .
